title: Pick a Time - Comprehensive Examples
description: Clock-based time picker for forms. Must be child of tpgb/tp-form-block. Supports 12/24-hour format, required validation, help text, custom sizing.

Make required for appointment forms (reqTgl: true)
Custom error message specific to context
Set uniqueid for backend processing (appointment_time)
Keep 100% width for better mobile experience
Use placeholder to indicate format (e.g., 'HH:MM' or '9:00 AM')

Test on mobile - inline can break if not configured properly

validationRules.labelss: Required - Field label displayed to user
validationRules.reqTgl: Optional - Boolean, true = required field, false = optional
validationRules.placeholder: Optional - Placeholder text, can be empty string
validationRules.inpSz: Optional - Responsive width {md, sm, xs, unit}, default 100%
validationRules.hlpTxt: Optional - Boolean, true = show help text, false = hide
validationRules.desctxt: Conditional - Required if hlpTxt is true, help text content
validationRules.descPoss: Optional - 'top' or 'bottom', position of help text, default 'top'
validationRules.error: Optional - Custom error message for required validation
validationRules.uniqueid: Optional - Unique field identifier for backend processing

warnings: Time picker allows free-form entry (users can type any time, not just picker values)
Validate time format on backend (HH:MM, 12/24-hour, AM/PM)
Time picker doesn't enforce specific slots - validate on server
Users may enter invalid times (25:00, 13:70) - add validation
Time zones are NOT captured by this field - handle separately if needed
Browser time picker UI varies (Chrome vs Firefox vs Safari)
Some browsers may not support time picker (fallback to text input)
Time picker may show 12-hour or 24-hour based on browser/OS locale
Mobile time pickers behave differently than desktop
Don't assume time format - normalize on backend (convert to 24-hour)
Time picker doesn't validate against business logic (opening hours, availability)
Placeholder text may not show in some browsers for time input type
commonMistakes: Not validating time format on backend (trusting client input)
Assuming all users use same time format (12-hour vs 24-hour)
Not specifying timezone (ambiguous for global users)
Using pixel width (inpSz: {md: '300', unit: 'px'}) instead of percentage (breaks responsive)
Forgetting to make mobile full-width (sm: 100) when using custom desktop width
Not providing clear placeholder or help text for expected format
Using generic error message ('This field is required') instead of context-specific
Not pairing start/end times in forms (appointment start without end)
Forgetting uniqueid for backend processing (field submissions get lost)
Using time picker for discrete slots (use dropdown instead for fixed options)
bestPractices: Use percentage width for responsive design (unit: '%')
Always set sm: 100 for mobile when using custom desktop width
Provide clear labels: 'Appointment Time' not just 'Time'
Use help text to clarify format, timezone, constraints
Set uniqueid for easy backend processing (use snake_case)
Validate time format on backend (never trust client)
Normalize times to 24-hour format on backend (consistent storage)
For time slots, consider dropdown instead of time picker (better UX)
Pair with date picker for complete datetime (side-by-side layout)
Use placeholder to hint at format (but don't rely on it)
Make required (reqTgl: true) for critical fields (appointments, events)
Provide timezone field separately if users are in different zones
Test across browsers (time picker UI varies)
Use custom error messages specific to field purpose
Validate logical constraints (start < end, within business hours)
accessibilityNotes: Time picker must have clear label (labelss attribute)
Screen readers announce label and input type (time)
Placeholder text is accessible hint (but not replacement for label)
Error messages are announced by screen readers when validation fails
Keyboard navigation: Tab to field, arrow keys to adjust time, Enter to confirm
Help text (desctxt) is associated with input for screen readers
Required fields should have visual indicator (asterisk) and aria-required
Error state should have aria-invalid when validation fails
Time picker native browser widget is generally accessible
Test with keyboard only (no mouse) to ensure full functionality
performanceConsiderations: Time picker is native HTML input (no external library = fast)
No performance impact on page load
Browser handles time picker UI (no additional JS)
Validation happens on form submit (minimal performance cost)
Help text adds minimal DOM nodes (negligible impact)

browserCompatibility.Mobile: Excellent - Native mobile time pickers are very UX-friendly
